cf.Field.data_axes¶

Field.data_axes()[source]¶

Return the domain axis identifiers for the data array dimensions.

See also

axes, axis, item_axes

Examples 1: 
>>> d = f.data_axes()
Returns:
out : list or None

The ordered axes of the data array. If there is no data array then None is returned.
Examples 2: 
>>> f.ndim
3
>>> f.data_axes()
['dim2', 'dim0', 'dim1']
>>> del f.Data
>>> print f.data_axes()
None

>>> f.ndim
0
>>> f.data_axes()
[]
